intro: Fumaria numidica var. longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed fumitory, is a flowering plant native to North Africa and the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and delicate, spurred flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant produces small, elongated seed pods that release tiny seeds when mature. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or arid environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and drought-tolerant landscapes.
